Language.Notes: Alemannic -- not a valid code, for compatibility. See gsw.
Belarusian in Taraskievica orthography; compat link
Crimean Tatar (multiple scripts - defaults to Latin)
Fijian Hindi (multiple scripts - defaults to Latin)
Inupiak (Inupiatun, Northwest Alaska / Inupiatun, North Alaskan)
Inuktitut, Eastern Canadian/Eastern Canadian "Eskimo"/"Eastern Arctic Eskimo"/Inuit (Unified Canadian Aboriginal Syllabics)
Inuktitut (macro language - do no localise, see ike/ikt - falls back to ike-cans)
Kongo, (FIXME!) should probaly be KiKongo or KiKoongo
Northern Kurdish (Arabic script) (falls back to ckb)
Komi-Zyrian (Cyrillic is common script but also written in Latin script)
Literary Chinese -- (bug 8217) lzh instead of zh-classical

Language.Notes: Nahuatl, en:Wikipedia writes Nahuatlahtolli, while another form is Náhuatl
Kalmyk-Oirat (Kalmuk, Kalmuck, Kalmack, Qalmaq, Kalmytskii Jazyk, Khal:mag, Oirat, Volga Oirat, European Oirat, Western Mongolian)
